<a id="CollisionPolygon3D"></a>

# CollisionPolygon3D

**Inherits:** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A node that provides a thickened polygon shape (a prism) to a [CollisionObject3D](CollisionObject3D.md) parent.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A node that provides a thickened polygon shape (a prism) to a [CollisionObject3D](CollisionObject3D.md) parent and allows to edit it. The polygon can be concave or convex. This can give a detection shape to an [Area3D](Area3D.md) or turn [PhysicsBody3D](PhysicsBody3D.md) into a solid object.

\ **Warning:** A non-uniformly scaled [CollisionShape3D](CollisionShape3D.md) will likely not behave as expected. Make sure to keep its scale the same on all axes and adjust its shape resource instead.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_debug_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **debug_color** = `Color(0, 0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_debug_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_debug_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_debug_color**\ (\ )

The collision shape color that is displayed in the editor, or in the running project if **Debug &gt; Visible Collision Shapes** is checked at the top of the editor.

\ **Note:** The default value is [ProjectSettings.debug/shapes/collision/shape_color](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_debug/shapes/collision/shape_color). The ``Color(0, 0, 0, 0)`` value documented here is a placeholder, and not the actual default debug color.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_debug_fill"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **debug_fill** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_debug_fill)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_enable_debug_fill**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_enable_debug_fill**\ (\ )

If ``true``, when the shape is displayed, it will show a solid fill color in addition to its wireframe.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_depth"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **depth** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_depth)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_depth**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_depth**\ (\ )

Length that the resulting collision extends in either direction perpendicular to its 2D polygon.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_disabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **disabled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_disabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_disabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_disabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, no collision will be produced. This property should be changed with [Object.set_deferred()](Object.md#Object_method_set_deferred).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_margin"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **margin** = `0.04` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_margin)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_margin**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_margin**\ (\ )

The collision margin for the generated [Shape3D](Shape3D.md). See [Shape3D.margin](Shape3D.md#Shape3D_property_margin) for more details.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon3D_property_polygon"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) **polygon** = `PackedVector2Array()` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon3D_property_polygon)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_polygon**\ (\ value\: [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md)\ )
- [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) **get_polygon**\ (\ )

Array of vertices which define the 2D polygon in the local XY plane.

**Note:** The returned array is *copied* and any changes to it will not update the original property value. See [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) for more details.
